title: J&P Power-natural monopoly pricing and regulation

content.question: Respond to all parts of the question. Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to "Calculate," you must show how you arrived at your final answer. <math alttext="L and P" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>L</mtext> <mi>＆</mi> <mtext>P</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> Power is a natural monopoly supplying electricity for a city. The firm produces the profit-maximizing quantity of electricity and earns a positive economic profit. (a) Describe a condition that distinguishes a natural monopoly from a typical monopoly. (b) Draw a correctly labeled graph for the natural monopoly market in which <math alttext="L and P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>L</mtext><mi>＆</mi><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Power operates and show each of the following. (i) The profit-maximizing quantity, labeled <math alttext="Q sub M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> (ii) The profit-maximizing price, labeled <math alttext="P sub M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> (iii) The area representing economic profit, shaded completely Suppose the government wants to regulate <math alttext="L and P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>L</mtext><mi>＆</mi><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to produce the maximum quantity that would allow it to earn zero economic profit. On your graph in part (b), show the maximum quantity it will produce to earn zero economic profit, labeled <math alttext="Q sub R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and price, labeled <math alttext="P sub R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext></mtext><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. (d) Suppose instead the government wants to regulate <math alttext="L and P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>L</mtext><mi>＆</mi><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to produce the allocatively efficient quantity. (i) Does <math alttext="L and P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>L</mtext><mi>＆</mi><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> earn positive economic profit if it produces the allocatively efficient quantity? Explain. (ii) Under what condition will <math alttext="L and P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>L</mtext><mi>＆</mi><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> agree to produce the allocatively efficient quantity?
